body: ''Thank goodness for global warming,'' Barry London, 35, joked on Sunday after planting himself on the sidewalk in front of Secret Project Robot, an art space in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn. Mr. London was stretched out on a bright green lawn chair that his friend Rachel Nelson had bought for $5.99. Ms. Nelson, 28, was sitting on a bench
title: Balmy Day Is a Breath Of Spring

body: GENNARELLI--Albert, on December 26, 2008. Loving husband of Lillian for over 55 years. He had his own law practice in Brooklyn, New York for many years. Viewing: Monday at Marine Park Funeral Home, 3024 Quentin Rd., Brooklyn, 2-5 and 7-9pm. Funeral Mass: Tuesday at 10am at Good Shepherd R.C. Church, Brooklyn.
title: Paid Notice: Deaths GENNARELLI, ALBERT

body: A young man waited for about a dozen other people to board the B46 bus on Tuesday morning before he got on and slowly approached the driver. The man, who appeared to be in his late teens, mumbled something, and the driver, Alvin Jones, acting on his 15 years of experience, simply nodded and let him on. As the man walked by, Mr. Jones pressed a
title: City Bus Drivers Say That Fare Beaters Have the Upper Hand in Confrontations

body: A New York City bus driver was fatally stabbed in Brooklyn on Monday after refusing to give a transfer to his assailant, who had not paid his fare, the police said. Witnesses said the killer jumped off the bus, slipped the hood of his black sweatshirt over his head and ran away. New York City Transit officials said it was the first slaying of a
title: Rider Fatally Stabs City Bus Driver and Flees

body: The ''Living In'' column last Sunday about Marine Park, Brooklyn, misidentified the shopping center on Flatbush Avenue near Avenue U. It is Kings Plaza, not Kings Highway Shopping Center.
title: Correction

body: MARINE PARK, a neighborhood of 21,500 people in southeast Brooklyn, shares its name and a boundary with the borough's largest park, a 798-acre mass that stretches to the marshes of Jamaica Bay. Still, when Eugenia Klopsis, an emergency medical technician, met her future husband, a Marine Park resident named David Moskowitz, at the Flatlands
title: LIVING IN | MARINE PARK, BROOKLYN; Isolation Is Pretty Splendid

body: KAFKA-KOHLHAGEN--Joi Meredith . Beloved wife of Robert Joel, daughter of Malcolm Edmond Kafka and Suzanne Leah Ullman Kafka. Passed in her sleep in the arms of the Lord November 2, 2008, North Babylon, LI. Born June 16, 1970 The Long Island Jewish Medical Center. Sister of Scott Laurance Kafka, niece of Stephen David Kafka, granddaughter of the
title: Paid Notice: Deaths KAFKA, KOHLHAGEN, JOI MEREDITH

body: Other Corners That Honor Ballplayers To the Editor: Re the F.Y.I. item on Sept. 28 about city monuments that honor ballplayers: There are others. Ruppert Park, on Second Avenue between 90th and 91st Streets, is named for Col. Jacob Ruppert, the Yankees owner who, with his partner, Tillinghast L'Hommedieu Huston, acquired Babe Ruth from the Boston
title: LETTERS TO THE EDITOR; Other Corners That Honor Ballplayers

body: THE same Ann Liv Young who has stepped onstage, torn off all her clothes and rolled around in her dog's ashes like a bereaved stripper (''Tribute to Elliot'') and has been penetrated with a dildo (''Snow White'') lives on a sleepy street in Marine Park, Brooklyn. On a recent summer night crickets chirped, fireflies etched tiny sparks in the
title: DANCE; George Washington Slept Here, Not Alone, And Tap-Danced, Too

body: AROUND TOWN BOCCE TOURNAMENT If space aliens landed on Earth, so the old joke goes, they would watch humans picking up after their dogs and mistake them for our masters. If they came this weekend, they might come upon what they believe to be a sect of humans who worship spheres, and in a sense they'd be right. As the New York City Parks and
title: Spare Times

body: BOCCE TOURNAMENT If space aliens landed on Earth, so the old joke goes, they would watch humans picking up after their dogs and mistake them for our masters. If they came this weekend, they might come upon what they believe to be a sect of humans who worship spheres, and in a sense they'd be right. As the New York City Parks and Recreation
title: Bocce Tournament

body: Max Ulitskiy flew his $3,000 Yak Extra 330L over Marine Park in Brooklyn. The plane swooped over a baseball field, then banked toward the runway. During the entire flight, Mr. Ulitskiy's feet were planted firmly on the ground. Mr. Ulitskiy, 32, is a member of the Radio Control Society of Marine Park, and he was flying a remote-controlled plane from
title: Model Airplane Club and Dirt Bikers Contend for Use of Brooklyn Runway

body: STORMS can roll in quickly across Breezy Point, Queens, which sits on a low-lying spit at the borough's southernmost edge, dangling into the Atlantic Ocean. When they do, Susan Hines, a therapist and part-time photographer, grabs her camera and heads to the stone jetty at Rockaway Point, hoping for that perfect shot of swirling clouds and waves. If
title: LIVING IN BREEZY POINT, QUEENS; Beach Living, 22 Miles From Manhattan

body: PARDO--Marie Elizabeth, on July 12, 2008. Loving sister of Bernice Cunningham and her husband Richard, Patricia Basile and her husband John, Bernard Reilly, John Reilly and the late Linda Thompson and her late husband George. Cherished aunt of 11 nieces and nephews. Dear grandaunt of 12 grandnieces and grandnephews. Funeral Tuesday, 10am from the
title: Paid Notice: Deaths PARDO, MARIE ELIZABETH

body: JAWORSKI--Malvina, on June 6, 2008 at age 100 in Philadelphia, PA. Beloved wife of the late Sigmund. Loving mother of Dorothy and Edward. Dear mother-in-law of Kathleen. Cherished grandmother of Jerome. Funeral Monday 9am from the Marine Park Funeral Home, 3024 Quentin Rd., Brooklyn. Funeral Mass 10am, Good Shepherd R.C. Church. Interment St.
title: Paid Notice: Deaths JAWORSKI, MALVINA

body: An article in some editions on May 22 about the questioning of three Brooklyn high school students after notes describing a murder plot were discovered included erroneous information from the police about the McDonald's restaurant where one of the named targets worked. It is in Brooklyn but not ''across the street'' from the school, James Madison
title: CORRECTIONS

body: Three students at James Madison High School in Brooklyn were questioned by investigators on Wednesday after notes were discovered describing a plan to kill people in and around the school, the police said. Classes were not affected. The notes were discovered near the end of the school day. The confiscated notes outlined a plan to kill three people
title: Students Questioned About Plot To Kill Three

body: TODER--Shulamis, nee Warshavsky, 94, died April 25, at home in Berkeley, California. Born in Antwerp, Belgium, she lived in Brooklyn until 1996. She is survived by Aaron, her loving husband of nearly 70 years, and three devoted children; Larry (Susan), Nan (Dan McClosky), and Steve (Naomi) Toder, four grandchildren, Karine, Matthew, Emily and
title: Paid Notice: Deaths TODER, SHULAMIS, NEE WARSHAVSKY

body: Marvin Sylvor, the merry-go-round man who dotted parks in New York City with fanciful painted ponies and went on to help populate the rest of the world with galloping steeds, flying manes and sparkly gold trappings on more than 60 carousels, died on Wednesday in Miami. He was 75. The cause was kidney failure, said his brother, Robert. His
title: Marvin Sylvor, a Designer of Carousels, Is Dead at 75

body: OPPENBERG--Arthur, passed on March 24, 2008 at home surrounded by his devoted wife Joan and loving daughters Deborah and Karen. For 35 years he worked for the Olivetti Corp. of America, finishing his tenure Executive Vice President of Sales/ Marketing and Supplies. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center,
title: Paid Notice: Deaths OPPENBERG, ARTHUR

body: COMING out of Ron Tolkin's digital recorder, the one he keeps in his left front pocket while he transcribes proceedings as a court reporter in Federal District Court in Brooklyn, the noises are hard to distinguish: some rustling of papers, lawyers making small talk, and then the sounds of shouting, struggling and chaos. It all lasts less than two
title: DISPATCHES; Superhero With a Stenograph

body: For James P. Kennelly, the developer of the building where a construction crane fell the length of a city block on Saturday, killing at least four people and injuring 13 others, the building catastrophe had a special resonance. Mr. Kennelly, 46, is a former New York City firefighter, a lifelong member of a special brotherhood. He is now a
title: Developer Who Can See From a Rescuer's View

body: STAPLETON--Marion Boyton , on January 30, 2008 in Alexandria, Virginia. Beloved wife of Gerard V. Loving mother of Jane, Robert, Roseanne, Anthony, and the late Gerard and Marion. Cherished grandmother of Matthew, Erol, Kaitlin, Zachary and Joseph. Dear greatgrandmother of Richard. Fond mother-in-law of the late Richard Bray. Special aunt to many
title: Paid Notice: Deaths STAPLETON, MARION BOYTON

body: It was a beautiful morning on Sept. 11, 2001, so Florence Cioffi made a decision that helped save her life: She left her office in the World Trade Center for a coffee break and was able to flee the devastation of the terrorist attack. Ms. Cioffi remained with the same company when it moved to Jersey City after 9/11, commuting from her home in
title: Woman Who Survived 9/11 Is Killed by a Car in the City
